author: Staff Reporter
text:
Chief Judicial Magistrate S. Malarmathy on Tuesday asked the police to produce all the 17 accused, including S. Yuvaraj, in the court on February 25, so that charge sheets in the V. Gokulraj murder case would be served to them.

The Crime Branch Criminal Investigation Department (CB-CID) that is investigating the Dalit youth’s murder case had on January 7 filed 725-page charge sheet naming 17 persons as accused in the case.

While Yuvaraj, founder of Theeran Chinnamalai Gounder Peravai was named as accused number one, his driver P. Arun, was named as accused number two. The magistrate had earlier asked the police to produce the 17 accused in the court on Tuesday.

The police were posted for duty in Kumbakonam, the accused were asked to produce on February 25.

Also, the judicial custody of Yuvaraj and Arun were extended till February 25 through video conferencing.
title: Gokulraj murder case: charge sheet to be served on February 25
